Types

ChartMode {...}{.pure.} = enum
  Key = 0,                  ## "Mania" game mode (SM, PIU, ...) with varying amount of keys (4,5,6,7, ...)k
  Catch = 3,                ## osu!catch
  Pad = 4,                  ## Jubeat
  Taiko = 5,                ## You should know taiko
  Ring = 6,                 ## Reflect Beat
  Slide = 7                  ## Mania but for touchscreen
The mode for a malody chart.   Source Edit 
SongData = object
  title*: string             ## Title of the song.
                             ## If the `titleorg` field exists, then this is should be the romanized/latin version
  titleorg*: string          ## Title of the song in the original language
  artist*: string            ## Artist of the song
                             ## If the `artistorg` field exists, then this is should be the romanized/latin version
  artistorg*: string         ## Arist of the song in the original language
  id*: int                   ## ID combination of the title & artist (only for ranked)
  Source Edit 
ModeData = object
  column*: int               ## Used in Mode "Key" to determine how many keys/columns it's using
  bar_begin: int ## Used in Mode "Key" to determine when the bar should start to be displayed
                 ## Usually it's the (index of the first note)-1 or 0
  speed: int                 ## The fall speed of the notes
  Source Edit 
MetaData = object
  `$ ver`*: int              ## Version of the chart-format
  creator*: string           ## Creator of the chart
  background*: string        ## Background image of the chart
  version*: string           ## Chart version (only for ranked)
  preview*: int              ## Offset in ms when the preview should start
  id*: uint                  ## ID of the chart (only for ranked)
  mode*: ChartMode           ## Mode of the Chart (For which game-mode this chart is available)
  time*: int                 ## Timestamp of when the chart was edited the last time
  song*: SongData            ## Song meta-data
  mode_ext*: ModeData        ## Extra Data specifically for the Mode
  Source Edit 
Beat = array[3, int]
  Source Edit 
TimedElement = object of RootObj
  beat*: Beat                ## The Beat on which this timed-element occurs
  Source Edit 
TimeSignature = object of TimedElement
  bpm*: float                ## The new BPM it's changing to
  Source Edit 
Chart = object
  meta*: MetaData            ## Meta data of the chart, such as version, creator and song data
  time*: seq[TimeSignature]  ## Time signatures of the chart (BPM changes)
  note*: seq[TimedElement]   ## Notes, Holds and other timed gameplay elements
A Malody chart-File object definition   Source Edit 
SlideNoteType {...}{.pure.} = enum
  Hold = 4
  Source Edit 
SoundCueType {...}{.pure.} = enum
  Effect = 0,               ## A sound effect which is simply played over the song.
  Song = 1,                 ## Sound/Actual song which is played for the entirety of the chart
  KeySound = 2               ## Sound which is only played for a certain note.
                             ## Usually ignored if the note hasn't been hit (see BMS)
  Source Edit 
SoundCue = object of TimedElement
  `type`*: int               ## Type of Sound-Cue that should be played
  sound*: string             ## (Relative) File-Path to the sound-file to play
  offset*: int               ## How much offset in ms it should wait before playing it
  vol*: float                ## How loud the sound should be played
  Source Edit 
IndexNote = object of TimedElement
  index*: TabIndexRange      ## Index of the Note (0-15) (When mode is "Pad")
Note for the following Modes: Pad   Source Edit 
ColumnNote = object of TimedElement
  column*: KeyColumnRange    ## The column in which this note is placed in
  style*: int                ## Taiko: Type of taiko-note
Note for following Modes: Key, Taiko, Ring   Source Edit 
VerticalNote = object of TimedElement
  x*: int                    ## X-Position of the Note
Note for the following Modes: Catch, Slide   Source Edit 
CatchNote = object of VerticalNote
  `type`*: CatchNoteType     ## Optional type of the note
Note for the following Modes: Catch   Source Edit 
SlideNote = object of VerticalNote
  w*: int                    ## Width of the Note
  `type`*: SlideNoteType     ## Optional type of the Note
  seg*: seq[VerticalNote]    ## Additional positions of the long note/slides
Note for the following Modes: Slide   Source Edit 
IndexHold = object of IndexNote
  endbeat*: Beat             ## Beat when the hold is being released
  endindex*: TabIndexRange   ## The index where the Hold is being released on
Hold for the following Modes: Pad   Source Edit 
ColumnHold = object of ColumnNote
  endbeat*: Beat             ## Beat when the hold is being released
  hits: int                  ## Taiko: Amount of hits the hold needs
Note for the following Modes: Key, Taiko, Ring   Source Edit 
CatchHold = object of CatchNote
  endbeat*: Beat             ## Beat when the hold is being released
